result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Lamont Whitehead

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin Lamont Whitehead appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defendant requests to represent himself.  Defendant is unable to turn on video.  Court will schedule case for in person date to hold colloquy with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Due to Court being down 10/7/2022, the 10/7/2022 pretrial conference is rescheduled to 11/4/2022 at 1:30 p.m. by zoom defendant notified via notice of hearing.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09-15-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nordstrom located in Mayfair Mall.
.

Defendant Kevin Lamont Whitehead in court. Student Intern Kyle Elderkin under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/13/22 @ 2:30p
